comment.body: @ks: hmm... Since markdown is supported I guess we could utilize some cool ascii-art as an image replacement
Tixati is awful for every non-user of it. It is also not fair towards the other peers.

@Quadrangle: it sends made-up meta-data to trick other peers and get higher download speeds instead of playing fair.
This is why most of the private trackers are blacklisting it.
@Quadrangle: Of course. I choose the comment that supports my statement.
@Nofish: Maybe no prefetching but loading on demand. I don't know how files would spread enough to be relatively available though.
The comments derailed from the topic a few times. I wont go into details but I mostly disagree with most things said.
If something doesn't work as you want, you can make a clone of it and tweak it the way you want it to.
@ks: Yeah it must be something else than limited quotas.
Statements about the future are pretty much always false so it has to be <D>.
